subject: Becoming Less
text:
Catch the waning 
moon. It may not come 
back tomorrow.

The traveller stops 
under the sun, not to ask 
for shade. The anger 
was rising.

Like candle light 
brightening your face 
in autumn halo.

Would you like 
to read a love sonnet 
to retrieve the lost 
Taj Mahel? 

Squeezing the cool 
bright moon in a glass of 
drink, I want to see you 
mutable moods.
